TERM_BASE.INTENTION: There is a related Term, Project Activity Sequence Number (Specific Usage), which has a display name for Component Activity Seq.

TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.BASIC_TEXT: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The activity sequence number. This is an unique number sequence that identifies a particular activity. It is a default generated by the system. \par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 Indicates that the MRP job has used alternate component(s) in its netting process.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The unique identity used to identify a case.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard Use this list to select how the shop order is closed. The value can be:\par \pard{\pntext\f0\'B7\tab}{\*\pn\pnlvlblt\pnf1\pnindent0{\pntxtb\'B7}}\fi-120\li120\b Auto close\b0 - The order closes automatically as soon as the quantity received falls within the closure tolerance. \par \b{\pntext\f0\'B7\tab}Manually close\b0 - You must close the order manually. The system checks to be sure that the number of parts received falls within the closure tolerance. \par \pard\fi-120\li120 \par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard Use this list to select how the shop order is closed. The value can be:\par \pard{\pntext\f0\'B7\tab}{\*\pn\pnlvlblt\pnf1\pnindent0{\pntxtb\'B7}}\fi-120\li120\b Auto close\b0 - The order closes automatically as soon as the quantity received falls within the closure tolerance. \par \b{\pntext\f0\'B7\tab}Manually close\b0 - You must close the order manually. The system checks to be sure that the number of parts received falls within the closure tolerance. \par \pard\fi-120\li120 \par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The date the shop order was closed.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 The percentage value of the closure tolerance of the shop order. If you set the closure tolerance to 10, for example, the order can be closed, even if 10% of the original lot size remains to be received. The default value is the close tolerance entered in \b\i Inventory Part/ Manufacturing\b0\i0 tab.\par }

TERM_BASE.INTENTION: This text is used only as a view column name. It is not ordinarily displayed to the public in the windows or web client.
This text is used only as a view column name. It is not ordinarily displayed to the public in the windows or web client.

TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.BASIC_TEXT: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The date on which the configuration specification was completed, and its status was set to Valid. A valid configuration specification contains valid values which have been specified for all mandatory configuration characteristics.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The condition code for the part, if any. This functionality is only used for serial and lot/batch parts that have condition code functionality enabled on the part catalog record.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 The line number of the component repair order. The number is system-generated and cannot be changed.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The unique ID number of the work order.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 The \f0 component\f0 \f0 line \f0 number of the customer order\f0 line for a package part.\f0\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 The ID number of the current order line is displayed. The line number is automatically created at order line registration. If more than one order line containing the same part is created, all of these lines will have the same line number. These lines are distinguished by having different delivery numbers.\f0\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The short name or identification number of the customer.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The ID number of the order. The order number is created at order registration and it cannot be altered.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard A customer order is automatically created when the purchase order using the outsourcing feature (charged or free of charge), is released. When the customer order is created, the customer order release number on the created customer order is displayed.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The date on which this record was created.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The origin of the demand for the shop order, e.g., an inventory order or a customer order.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The origin of the demand for the shop order, e.g., an inventory order or a customer order.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard Disposition line number for the activity.\par }

TERM_BASE.INTENTION: There is a parallel term Shop Order Number (Specific Display) that contains the display name Source Shop Order Number

TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.BASIC_TEXT: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The shop order number.\par }

TERM_BASE.INTENTION: This term should only be used for fields that can display different kinds of release number.

TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.BASIC_TEXT: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard If the origin of the transaction is an order, the order release number is displayed here. The source of the order could be, for example, a customer order or a work order. The unique identification for an order could differ for each source of the order.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 The sequence number for the disposition shop order and release number.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The earliest date on which the order can be started.\par }

TERM_BASE.INTENTION: There is a related term Manufacturing Part Revision (Specific Display) that contains the display name and usage for the work scope dialog where part revision is specified.

TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.BASIC_TEXT: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The revision number for the part.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The type of service required if the part is to be sent out for external service.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard This field shows the job ID that comes from customer order line and will be used to trace actual cost from a job in the general ledger.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The last date on which any change was made on this record.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 The lot batch number of the specified part. \f0 A lot or batch is a quantity of parts produced together that shares the same production specifications and costs. Each item is numbered uniquely to make it possible to track to the original supplier shipment or production run. \f0 If the part is not traced, the value * (asterisk) will appear. Only parts set to Lot Tracking or Order Based on the \b\i Part Catalog/General\b0\i0 tab can be traced further.\f0\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The alphanumeric prefix to attach to the related lot batch numbers.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard Select the \b Maintenance Level Routings\b0 checkbox to promote any maintenance level routings for the part to \b Active\b0 . This is enabled if the \b Site\b0 is flagged for MRO usage, the \b Structure Types\b0 \b Assembly\b0 and \b Disassembly\b0 are checked, the \b Structure Status\b0 is \b Buildable\b0 , and a Position Part is selected.\f0\par }
TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.USAGE_NAME: Entry, ML Routing Checkbox Multi-level Promote

TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.BASIC_TEXT: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard Select the \b Maintenance Level Structures\b0 checkbox to promote any maintenance level structures for the part to \b Active\b0 . This is enabled if the \b Site\b0 is flagged for MRO usage, the \b Structure Types\b0 \b Assembly\b0 and \b Disassembly\b0 are checked, the \b Structure Status\b0 is \b Buildable\b0 , and a Position Part is selected.\f0\par }
TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.USAGE_NAME: Entry, ML Structures Checkbox Multi-level Promote

TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.BASIC_TEXT: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 Indicates whether the user has finished including/excluding modifications for the disposition line. \f0 Possible values are \b Done\b0 and \b Not Done.\b0\f0\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 Indicates whether the user has finished including/excluding modifications for the disposition line. \f0 Possible values are \b Done\b0 and \b Not Done.\b0\f0\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 A unique identifier for the MRB Case.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The identifier of the interim demand head structure.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The unique ID number of the work order.\par }

TERM_BASE.INTENTION: 060609 IRCASE: Added Genetive "SO Need Date" as this is the label we use in Engineering.

TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.BASIC_TEXT: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The latest date the order can be completed.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The ID number of any note associated with each subordinate order.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 This is a free-text field of up to 2000 characters. Notes are object-linked text, but they are never printed like document texts; instead they function as your own notes and comments for internal reference only. A note can be used as a means of forwarding information to someone who will process the object later.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The quantity of the parts scrapped during the manufacturing process.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The manufacturing structure type. Possible values are \b Manufacturing\b0 , \b Purchase\b0 and \b Repair\b0 .\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The manufacturing structure type. Possible values are \b Manufacturing\b0 , \b Purchase\b0 and \b Repair\b0 .\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The ID number of the order. The order number is created at order registration and it cannot be altered.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The original date the required quantity of this part should be available.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 The original order quantity for the pegged DOP supply order.\f0\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The date on which the order processing was originally scheduled to start.\par }

TERM_BASE.INTENTION: BRPESE: Generally the initial sentence in these usages, 'If the stock is externally-owned, the owner of the stock.' is not a good sentence. People working with this functioanlity had difficulties in understandning the usages. Consider revising all of them!

TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.BASIC_TEXT: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard If the ownership type is \b Customer Owned\b0 , the ID of the owning customer.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The identifier of the part to be manufactured.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The type of ownership for the MRO object is \b Customer Owned\b0 . This is externally-owned stock that is supplied by a customer (or a supplier for the customer) with the intent that the material will be transformed (maintained, repaired, overhauled, or used as a component) and eventually returned to the customer (or supplier).\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The type of ownership for the MRO object is \b Customer Owned\b0 . This is externally-owned stock that is supplied by a customer (or a supplier for the customer) with the intent that the material will be transformed (maintained, repaired, overhauled, or used as a component) and eventually returned to the customer (or supplier).\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard A checkbox to indicate if a partial part receipt is expected. This will only be checked for Disassembly shop orders.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The type of pick list. The determines what information the pick list contains. Possible values are \b Standard\b0 and \b Warehouse\b0 . \b Pick list for shop order\b0 : This pick list contains all material not already printed on a pick list. \b Pick list for subcontracting operation\b0 : This pick list contains materials for the subcontracting operations to be performed by a subcontractor. \b Pick list for operation\b0 : This pick list contains information about the material linked to the current operation. \b Pick list for non-linked material\b0 : This pick list contains all material not linked to a specific operation.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The type of pick list. The determines what information the pick list contains. Possible values are \b Standard\b0 and \b Warehouse\b0 . \b Pick list for shop order\b0 : This pick list contains all material not already printed on a pick list. \b Pick list for subcontracting operation\b0 : This pick list contains materials for the subcontracting operations to be performed by a subcontractor. \b Pick list for operation\b0 : This pick list contains information about the material linked to the current operation. \b Pick list for non-linked material\b0 : This pick list contains all material not linked to a specific operation.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 Quantity that is planned to be scraped on the shop order. This value is calculated as scrap factor (%) \'d7 lot size. MRP will not compensate for scrap that does not exceed the planned scrap.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard If the transaction was pre-posted, the number of the posting created by the specified material transaction.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 Enter the priority number for the PPSA in this Planned Netting Group. This priority number determines which PPSA will use existing supplies first, e.g., project inventory, open orders\f0 , etc.\f0 . Priority 1 is higher than priority 2. If two PPSAs have demands on the same date, \f0 the \f0 PPSA with higher priority will use existing supplies to satisfy it's demand first.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The shop order process type associated with the specified shop order.\par }
TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.USAGE_NAME: Display, Associated with a Specific Shop Order

TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.BASIC_TEXT: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The identification of the project to which the connected activity belongs.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard A suggested inventory location for goods receipt.\par }

TERM_BASE.INTENTION: There is a linked term Part Quantity Scrapped (Specific Display) with usages and diplay nmaes for DOP Supply

TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.BASIC_TEXT: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The quantity of the part that has been scrapped.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The quantity of the parts completed and received into inventory.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 The original component quantity required less the sum of substitute components entered in the table below.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The quantity of the component part that has open supply orders on it.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The quantity of the selected part that is currently in quality control for testing and analysis.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The quantity of the by-product not approved at quality control. You cannot update the value in this column.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard This column displays the quantity that is converted to the customer order line.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The code that indicates why the parts were scrapped.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard Displays the release number. This is a number that can be added to the order number to make it unique. This field is optional. If you do not enter a release number, an asterisk (*) appears in the field.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard Select this check box to reschedule relevant operations after unscheduling the resource break.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard Select this check box to reschedule relevant operations after unscheduling the resource break.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The most recently revised date on which the quantity due should be on hand.\par }

TERM_BASE.INTENTION: There is a related term Revised Order Quantity (Specific Usage) for the display name Revised Qty Due.

TERM_USAGE_DEFINITION_BASE.BASIC_TEXT: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The quantity of each part that will be manufactured.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The date on which each order is planned to start.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The ID number of the routing alternate for this part.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The revision number of the routing.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The type of capacity used to schedule the shop order. Possible values are \b Infinite capacity\b0 and \b Finite capacity\b0 .\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The type of capacity used to schedule the shop order. Possible values are \b Infinite capacity\b0 and \b Finite capacity\b0 .\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The scheduling direction for the specified shop order. Possible values are Backwards Scheduling and Forward Scheduling.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The scheduling direction for the specified shop order. Possible values are Backwards Scheduling and Forward Scheduling.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The sequence number. This is a number that can be added to the order number to make it unique. This field is optional. If you do not enter a sequence number, an asterisk (*) appears in the field.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard For a serialized part, the beginning number of the serial number range.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard For a serialized part, the ending number of the serial number range.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The percentage of the amount manufactured that is lost in the manufacturing process.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The ID of the person who created the shop order requisition.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The Shop Order primary identifier.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard Displays the release number. This is a number that can be added to the order number to make it unique. This field is optional. If you do not enter a release number, an asterisk (*) appears in the field.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The sequence number. This is a number that can be added to the order number to make it unique. This field is optional. If you do not enter a sequence number, an asterisk (*) appears in the field.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The reason code used when the order was split.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The ID of the structure alternate for the part.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard The unique identity of the task.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 If checked, the operation, general overhead and component costs will be divided between primary product and by-products according to the factors in the \b\i Product Structure\b0\i0 and \b\i By-Product Cost Distribution\b0\i0 tabs.\par }

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard\f0 If checked, the operation, general overhead and component costs will be divided between primary product and by-products according to the factors in the \b\i Product Structure\b0\i0 and \b\i By-Product Cost Distribution\b0\i0 tabs.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard A brief description of the guideline. This information is retrieved from the work guideline definition.\par }
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252{\fonttbl{\f0}}\fs20\pard A brief description of the guideline. This information is retrieved from the work guideline definition.\par }
